translation.title: Ten Discourses On How Giving Helps to Become Egg-Born

next.name: Thirty Discourses On How Giving Helps to Become Womb-Born, Etc.

segments.en: 11–20. Ten Discourses On How Giving Helps to Become Egg-Born

segments.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho so bhikkhu bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Seated to one side, that mendicant said to the Buddha:

segments.pli: “ko nu kho, bhante, hetu, ko paccayo, yena midhekacco kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā aṇḍajānaṃ nāgānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjatī”ti?
segments.en: “Sir, what is the cause, what is the reason why someone, when their body breaks up, after death, is reborn in the company of the egg-born dragons?”

segments.pli: “Idha, bhikkhu, ekacco kāyena dvayakārī hoti, vācāya dvayakārī, manasā dvayakārī.
segments.en: “Mendicant, it’s when someone does both kinds of deeds by body, speech, and mind.
‘The egg-born dragons are long-lived, beautiful, and very happy.’

segments.pli: ‘aho vatāhaṃ kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā aṇḍajānaṃ nāgānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjeyyan’ti.
segments.en: ‘If only, when my body breaks up, after death, I would be reborn in the company of the egg-born dragons!’

segments.pli: So kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā aṇḍajānaṃ nāgānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjati.
Ayaṃ kho, bhikkhu, hetu … pe … upapajjatīti … pe …
So kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā aṇḍajānaṃ nāgānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjati.
segments.en: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in the company of the egg-born dragons.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ kho, bhikkhu, hetu, ayaṃ paccayo, yena midhekacco kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā aṇḍajānaṃ nāgānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjatī”ti.
segments.en: This is the cause, this is the reason why someone, when their body breaks up, after death, is reborn in the company of the egg-born dragons.”
